isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - CYLINDER HEAD AND VALVES - CYLINDER HEAD REMOVAL - HEAD BOLT TORQUE VERIFICATION (PULL-UP-TO-THE-MARK METHOD)

step1.para:
Remove the valve cover bolts and grommets, then remove the valve cover and gasket. Discard the gasket ( Figure 4.9
).

2. Verify cylinder head bolt torque, before removing the cylinder head, as follows: ( Figure 4.10
)

step2.para: Mark the edge of the socket and a point on the cylinder head that is in line with the socket mark.
Using a breaker-bar, loosen the bolt one-eighth of a turn.
Without disturbing the socket location, remove the breaker-bar and install a torque wrench in its place.
Tighten the bolt until the socket mark and the cylinder head marks are aligned.
With marks aligned, record the torque reading.
Repeat this procedure for all cylinder head bolts.

figure.caption: Figure 4.10. Checking Bolt Torque (Using Pull-up-to-the-Mark Method).

step1.para:
Loosen the rocker arm adjusting nuts and screws. Then remove the rocker arm bracket bolts (long cylinder head bolts). Remove the rocker arm assembly from the cylinder head. Refer to Figure 4.11
.

note.para: Loosening the rocker arm adjusting nuts and screws 1/2 turn will avoid possible valve train damage during installation.
THIS STAGE OF DISASSEMBLY PROVIDES AN IDEAL TIME TO MEASURE CAMSHAFT LOBE LIFT. FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS IN "CAMSHAFT, TAPPETS, PUSH RODS AND ROCKER ARM ASSEMBLY".
